name: Information Security Management Policy
description: Top-level ISMS policy establishing Rackspace Technology's direction and support for information security. Sets risk management framework in accordance with business requirements, relevant laws, and regulations. Requires management approval, periodic review, and organization-wide communication. Confirmed on rackspace.com/security/cloud-security-policy: 'The policy establishes Rackspace Technology's direction and support for information security.' ISO 27001 cert IS 636168 requires this as mandatory clause 5.2 policy. com/security/cloud-security-policy, ISO 27001:2022 Clause 5.2, 10-K FY2024 Item 1C.

name: Code of Conduct and Business Ethics
description: Corporate ethics policy setting standards for employee, officer, and director conduct. Covers anti-corruption, conflicts of interest, insider trading, confidentiality, and workplace behavior. Published on rackspace.com/information/legal. Listed in ir.rackspace.com governance documents alongside Corporate Governance Guidelines and Global Speak Up Policy. com/information/legal/code-of-conduct, ir.rackspace.com/corporate-governance/documents-and-charters.

name: Corporate Governance Guidelines
description: Board-level governance standards establishing fiduciary duties, committee structures, and oversight responsibilities. Published as downloadable PDF (43.2 KB) on ir.rackspace.com. rackspace.com/corporate-governance/documents-and-charters.

name: Global Speak Up Policy
description: Whistleblower and ethics reporting policy enabling confidential reporting of misconduct, fraud, or violations. Published as downloadable PDF (252.7 KB) on ir.rackspace.com. Required under SOX Section 301 for audit committee complaint procedures. rackspace.com/corporate-governance/documents-and-charters.

name: Acceptable Use Policy
description: Customer-facing policy defining prohibited activities on Rackspace services including abuse, offensive content, spam, export violations, and unauthorized vulnerability testing. Published at rackspace.com/information/legal/global/aup. Covers eight domains: abuse generally, offensive behavior, export compliance, email/spam, vulnerability testing, content responsibility, third-party conduct, cooperation with authorities. com/en-nl/information/legal/global/aup.

name: Privacy Notice
description: Public-facing privacy notice describing collection, use, sharing, and protection of personal information across Rackspace Technology global operations. Covers data sources, purposes, retention, cross-border transfers, cookie usage, rights exercise mechanisms. Chief Privacy Officer designated as DPO contact at privacy@rackspace.com. com/information/legal/privacystatement.

name: Customer Data Processing Addendum
description: Contractual addendum to Master Services Agreement establishing data processing obligations under applicable data protection law. Incorporates EU Standard Contractual Clauses for cross-border transfers. Defines controller/processor relationships, sub-processor obligations, security measures, breach notification, and audit rights. com/gdpr, rackspace.com/information/legal/GSAdataprocessingaddendum_MC.

name: UK Tax Strategy
description: Published UK tax strategy as required under Finance Act 2016 Schedule 19 for qualifying UK entities. Published as downloadable PDF (156.4 KB) on ir.rackspace.com. rackspace.com/corporate-governance/documents-and-charters.

name: Security Vulnerability Reporting Policy
description: Public disclosure process for responsible reporting of security vulnerabilities affecting Rackspace Technology services. Provides mechanism for external researchers to submit vulnerability reports with commitment to timely response. com/information/legal (Security Vulnerability Reporting link).

name: Law Enforcement Request Policy
description: Policy governing response to formal law enforcement requests for customer data. Requires subpoena/equivalent for non-content data and warrant/court order for content data. Annual Law Enforcement Request Disclosure Report published. com/information/legal/privacycenter.

name: Access Control Policy
description: Policy establishing framework for granting, reviewing, and revoking logical access to Rackspace systems and resources. Ensures only approved users access appropriate systems based on role and need-to-know. Confirmed on rackspace.com/security/cloud-security-policy: 'Framework to ensure only approved users are granted access to appropriate systems and resources.' Maps to ISO 27001:2022 A.5.15-A.5.18, NIST 800-53 AC family, PCI DSS Req 7-8. com/security/cloud-security-policy.

name: Incident Response Policy
description: Policy and procedures for identification, containment, eradication, recovery, and lessons learned for security incidents. Ensures security events and weaknesses are communicated for timely corrective action. Includes escalation procedures for materiality determination per SEC disclosure requirements. Confirmed on rackspace.com/security/cloud-security-policy: 'Policies and processes aimed at making sure information security events and weaknesses are communicated in a manner allowing timely corrective action.' 10-K Item 1C confirms 'effective response to cybersecurity incidents (including escalation procedures).' com/security/cloud-security-policy, 10-K FY2024 Item 1C.

name: Physical Security Policy
description: Policy preventing unauthorized physical access, damage, and interference to organizational premises and information assets. Covers data center physical security perimeters, entry controls, CCTV/EVSS, visitor management, and environmental protections. Confirmed on rackspace.com/security/cloud-security-policy: 'To prevent unauthorized physical access, damage, and interference to our organization's premises and information.' Privacy Notice confirms EVSS usage. com/security/cloud-security-policy, rackspace.com/information/legal/privacystatement.

name: Human Resources Security Policy
description: Policy ensuring employees, contractors, and third-party users understand security responsibilities and are suitable for their roles. Covers pre-employment screening, security awareness during employment, and termination/change-of-employment procedures. Confirmed on rackspace.com/security/cloud-security-policy: 'Controls to ensure that all Rackspace Technology employees, contractors and third party users understand their responsibilities.' com/security/cloud-security-policy.

name: Critical Infrastructure Protection Policy
description: Policy focused on achieving and maintaining appropriate protection of Rackspace Technology's critical infrastructure required for service delivery. Confirmed on rackspace.com/security/cloud-security-policy: 'This area focuses on achieving and maintaining appropriate protection of Rackspace Technology's critical infrastructure required for its service delivery.' com/security/cloud-security-policy.

name: Data Classification Policy
description: Policy establishing rules for classifying, labeling, and handling data based on sensitivity levels. Defines classification tiers (e.g., public, internal, confidential, restricted) and corresponding handling requirements. Rackspace data privacy page explicitly references 'Create a data classification policy. Establish the sensitivity of each type of data.' Required by ISO 27001 A.5.12-A.5.13, PCI DSS Req 3, NIST 800-53 RA-2. com/security/data-privacy-protection, ISO 27001:2022 Annex A.

name: Cryptographic Controls and Key Management Policy
description: Policy governing use of cryptographic controls including encryption algorithms, key generation, distribution, storage, rotation, and destruction. Rackspace is FIPS 140-2 compliant for government workloads. Data privacy page references 'encryption tools, key management automation.' Required by ISO 27001 A.8.24, PCI DSS Req 3.5-3.7/4, NIST 800-53 SC-12/SC-13, FIPS 140-2. com/security/data-privacy-protection, Carahsoft FIPS 140-2 listing.

name: Network Security Policy
description: Policy governing network architecture, segmentation, firewall management, intrusion detection/prevention, and secure network communications. Required for PCI DSS Req 1-2 (network segmentation, firewall), NIST 800-53 SC family, ISO 27001 A.8.20-A.8.23. Rackspace provides managed firewall, IDS/IPS, and network security services. com/security (network security services), ISO 27001:2022 Annex A, PCI DSS v4.0.

name: Change Management Policy
description: Policy governing approval, testing, documentation, and rollback procedures for changes to production systems, infrastructure, and applications. Required by ISO 27001 A.8.32, PCI DSS Req 6.5, NIST 800-53 CM family, SOC 2 CC8.1. Inferred as mandatory for maintaining FedRAMP continuous monitoring authorization. 0, NIST 800-53 CM family.

provenance.primary_data_source: ISO 27001:2022 Annex A, PCI DSS v4

name: Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Policy
description: Policy establishing requirements for business continuity planning, disaster recovery, and ICT resilience. Covers RTO/RPO definitions, DR testing, failover procedures, and continuity of critical services. Rackspace offers Rackspace Data Protection (backup) and managed DR services. Required by ISO 27001 A.5.29-A.5.30, NIST 800-53 CP family, SOC 2 A1. Rackspace 10-K Item 1C references 'continually evaluate our cybersecurity policies and procedures' including resilience.

provenance.primary_data_source: 10-K FY2024, ISO 27001:2022 Annex A, NIST 800-53 CP

name: Vulnerability Management Policy
description: Policy establishing requirements for vulnerability scanning, assessment, prioritization, and remediation across Rackspace-managed infrastructure and applications. Rackspace offers vulnerability scanning and penetration testing services. Required by PCI DSS Req 6.1-6.3/11, NIST 800-53 RA-5/SI-2, ISO 27001 A.8.8. com/security/security-strategy (vulnerability scanning and pen testing services), PCI DSS v4.0.

name: Logging and Monitoring Policy
description: Policy governing security event logging, log retention, log protection, and continuous monitoring requirements. Rackspace SOC provides 24x7x365 monitoring with 13-month log retention. Required by PCI DSS Req 10, NIST 800-53 AU family, ISO 27001 A.8.15-A.8.16, SOC 2 CC7.1-CC7.4. com/security (13-month log management and retention), ISO 27001:2022 Annex A.

name: Asset Management Policy
description: Policy governing identification, classification, ownership, and lifecycle management of information assets including hardware, software, data, and services. Required by ISO 27001 A.5.9-A.5.14, NIST 800-53 CM-8/PM-5, PCI DSS Req 2.4/9.9.

name: Third-Party Risk Management Policy
description: Policy establishing requirements for vetting, onboarding, monitoring, and managing security risks from third-party providers and sub-processors. 10-K Item 1C explicitly states: 'Our cybersecurity policies and procedures are designed to vet key third-party providers and provide for oversight and cooperation regarding cybersecurity incidents.' DPA requires sub-processor data protection terms no less restrictive than DPA. com/gdpr (sub-processor obligations).

name: Security Awareness and Training Policy
description: Policy requiring regular security awareness training for all employees and role-based training for personnel with security responsibilities. Required by ISO 27001 A.6.3, NIST 800-53 AT family, PCI DSS Req 12.6, HIPAA 45 CFR 164.308(a)(5), FedRAMP. 10-K Item 1C references cross-functional security stakeholders and senior management engagement.

provenance.primary_data_source: 10-K FY2024 Item 1C, ISO 27001:2022 Annex A, NIST 800-53 AT

name: Data Retention and Disposal Policy
description: Policy governing retention periods, archival requirements, and secure destruction of data across all media types. Required by GDPR Art 5(1)(e) storage limitation, ISO 27001 A.8.10 information deletion, NIST 800-53 SI-12, PCI DSS Req 3.1. Rackspace Privacy Notice references retention practices. com/information/legal/privacystatement, ISO 27001:2022 A.8.10.

name: Breach Notification Policy
description: Policy establishing procedures and timelines for notifying affected individuals, regulators, and law enforcement following a data breach or security incident. Must accommodate multiple notification regimes: GDPR 72-hour supervisory authority notification, SEC 4-business-day materiality disclosure, Texas AG 30-day notification, HIPAA 60-day notification, AU NDB scheme. 053, HIPAA Breach Notification Rule.

provenance.primary_data_source: GDPR Art 33-34, SEC Cyber Rule, TX ITEPA §521

name: Cybersecurity Risk Management Policy
description: Policy establishing enterprise cybersecurity risk management framework including risk identification, assessment, treatment, acceptance, and monitoring. 10-K Item 1C explicitly describes: 'cybersecurity strategies for preservation of the confidentiality, integrity and availability of company and customer information' and 'identification, prevention and mitigation of cybersecurity threats and incidents.' References cross-functional stakeholder group meeting regularly.

name: Endpoint Security Policy
description: Policy governing endpoint protection including anti-malware, endpoint detection and response (EDR), device hardening, and mobile device management. Rackspace offers managed endpoint security services. Required by NIST 800-53 SI-3/SC-7, ISO 27001 A.8.1, PCI DSS Req 5. com/security (endpoint security services), NIST 800-53.

name: Secure Development Lifecycle Policy
description: Policy establishing secure coding practices, code review requirements, and security testing throughout the software development lifecycle. Required by ISO 27001 A.8.25-A.8.31 (secure development), PCI DSS Req 6, NIST 800-53 SA family. Rackspace offers DevSecOps and application security services. com/security (application security services), ISO 27001:2022 Annex A.

name: Identity and Authentication Management Policy
description: Policy governing identity lifecycle management, multi-factor authentication, privileged access management, and credential security. Required by NIST 800-53 IA family, PCI DSS Req 8, ISO 27001 A.8.2-A.8.5, FedRAMP. 0 Req 8.

provenance.primary_data_source: NIST 800-53 IA family, PCI DSS v4

name: Cloud Security Policy
description: Policy establishing security requirements for cloud service delivery including shared responsibility model, cloud-specific controls, tenant isolation, and cloud security architecture. Rackspace security page dedicated to cloud security management. Required by ISO 27001 A.5.23 (cloud services), CSA CCM, ISO 27017. com/security/cloud-security-policy.

name: Media Handling and Disposal Policy
description: Policy governing secure handling, transport, storage, and destruction of physical and electronic media containing sensitive data. Required by ISO 27001 A.7.10/A.7.14, PCI DSS Req 9.4, NIST 800-53 MP family, NIST 800-88 media sanitization.

name: Backup and Recovery Policy
description: Policy governing data backup frequency, integrity verification, offsite storage, and recovery testing requirements. Rackspace offers Rackspace Data Protection powered by Cohesity. Required by ISO 27001 A.8.13, NIST 800-53 CP-9/CP-10, PCI DSS Req 12.10.1. rackspace.com/docs/rackspace-data-protection, ISO 27001:2022 Annex A.

name: Threat Intelligence Policy
description: Policy establishing requirements for collecting, analyzing, and acting on cybersecurity threat intelligence. New control in ISO 27001:2022 (A.5.7). Rackspace SOC provides threat intelligence as part of managed security services. com/security (threat intelligence services), ISO 27001:2022 A.5.7.

name: Configuration Management Policy
description: Policy governing baseline configurations, hardening standards, and configuration change tracking for systems, networks, and applications. New control in ISO 27001:2022 (A.8.9). Required by NIST 800-53 CM family, PCI DSS Req 2, CIS Benchmarks. 8.9, NIST 800-53 CM.

name: Data Leak Prevention Policy
description: Policy establishing controls to detect and prevent unauthorized disclosure of sensitive data through network, endpoint, and cloud channels. New control in ISO 27001:2022 (A.8.12). Required by PCI DSS Req 12.5.2, NIST 800-53 SC-7. Rackspace data privacy page references data protection controls. 8.12, rackspace.com/security/data-privacy-protection.

name: Export Control and Sanctions Compliance Policy
description: Policy ensuring Rackspace services are not used in violation of US export control laws (ITAR, EAR), sanctions (OFAC SDN), or international trade restrictions. AUP explicitly states: 'Customer shall ensure Services are not used in breach of export laws, controls, regulations or sanction policies.' ITAR compliance confirmed via Carahsoft listing. com/en-nl/information/legal/global/aup, Carahsoft ITAR listing.

name: Internal Audit and Compliance Monitoring Policy
description: Policy establishing internal audit program for continuous compliance validation and control effectiveness assessment. Rackspace cloud security page references 'compliance and validation phase' as 'important collection of audit and review activities.' SOC 1/2/3 attestation confirms operating effectiveness testing. Required by ISO 27001 Clause 9.2, SOX Section 404, NIST 800-53 CA family. com/security/cloud-security-policy, SOC attestation program.

name: Data Privacy Impact Assessment Policy
description: Policy establishing requirements for conducting Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) for high-risk processing activities. Required by GDPR Art 35, UK GDPR, and recommended under multiple state privacy laws. Rackspace as processor supports customer DPIAs per DPA obligations.

provenance.primary_data_source: GDPR Art 35, UK Data Protection Act 2018

name: Insider Threat Policy
description: Policy establishing controls for detecting, preventing, and responding to insider threats including privileged user monitoring, behavioral analytics, and separation of duties. Required by NIST 800-53 PM-12, CMMC, and NIST SP 800-171 for CUI environments.

name: Controlled Unclassified Information Handling Policy
description: Policy governing identification, marking, safeguarding, transport, and destruction of CUI in accordance with NIST SP 800-171 and DFARS 252.204-7012. Applicable to Rackspace Government Solutions handling defense contractor data. 204-7012, NIST SP 800-171, 32 CFR Part 2002.

name: Environmental and Sustainability Policy
description: Policy establishing environmental management commitments, energy efficiency targets, and sustainability objectives for data center and office operations. Published as 'Commitment to Occupational Health and Safety & Environmental Sustainability Policy.' ISO 14001 cert EMS 581182 for AU and UK. ISO 45001 cert OHS 587454. com/compliance/iso.

name: PCI Cardholder Data Environment Policy
description: Policy governing protection, segmentation, and processing controls for environments handling payment card data. Covers cardholder data flow mapping, scope reduction, quarterly ASV scanning, and annual PCI DSS assessment. Rackspace holds PCI DSS Level 1 Service Provider certification for US, UK, Hong Kong, and Australia. com/compliance/pci, PCI DSS v4.0.

name: HIPAA Security and Privacy Policy
description: Policy establishing administrative, physical, and technical safeguards for electronic protected health information (ePHI) in business associate capacity. Covers BAA requirements, minimum necessary standard, breach notification, and PHI access controls. Rackspace provides HIPAA-compliant hosting with BAA support. com/compliance (HIPAA), 45 CFR Parts 160/162/164.

name: FedRAMP Continuous Monitoring Policy
description: Policy establishing continuous monitoring program for FedRAMP-authorized cloud service offerings including monthly vulnerability scanning, annual penetration testing, Plan of Action & Milestones (POA&M) management, and monthly security status reporting to authorizing officials. Rackspace Government Solutions holds FedRAMP JAB Moderate authorization. com/compliance/fedramp, FedRAMP Continuous Monitoring Strategy Guide.

name: Artificial Intelligence Governance Policy
description: Policy establishing governance framework for development, deployment, and monitoring of AI/ML systems including risk assessment, bias testing, transparency, human oversight, and data governance. Rackspace AI Anywhere service and EU AI Act obligations require structured AI governance. Inferred from EU AI Act applicability, Rackspace AI service portfolio, and industry trajectory. com AI Anywhere.

name: Supplier Data Processing Agreement Policy
description: Policy establishing requirements for flowing data protection obligations to Rackspace's own suppliers and sub-processors. Rackspace Supplier DPA requires: 24-hour security incident notification, GDPR-equivalent confidentiality obligations, audit rights, sub-processor notification, and data return/destruction. com/rackspace-data-processing-addendum).

name: Patch Management Policy
description: Policy governing identification, testing, prioritization, and deployment of security patches across all managed infrastructure. Required by PCI DSS Req 6.3 (critical patches within 30 days), NIST 800-53 SI-2, ISO 27001 A.8.8. 0 Req 6.3, NIST 800-53 SI-2.

name: Cross-Border Data Transfer Policy
description: Policy governing mechanisms and safeguards for international transfers of personal data including Standard Contractual Clauses, EU-US Data Privacy Framework certification, adequacy decisions, and Transfer Impact Assessments. Rackspace operates follow-the-sun support model requiring cross-border data access. com/gdpr (SCC/DPF references), Customer DPA.

name: Records Management and Retention Policy
description: Policy governing corporate records retention schedules, legal hold procedures, and destruction authorization. Required by SOX (financial records 7-year retention), SEC Rules 17a-3/17a-4, and multiple privacy laws. Separate from data retention/disposal for customer data.

provenance.primary_data_source: SOX Section 802, SEC Record Retention Rules

name: SEC Cybersecurity Materiality Determination Policy
description: Policy establishing internal procedures for determining whether a cybersecurity incident is material under SEC rules, triggering 4-business-day Form 8-K Item 1.05 disclosure obligation. Covers escalation criteria, materiality assessment framework, disclosure committee coordination, and DOJ delay request procedures. 10-K Item 1C confirms 'escalation procedures of certain cybersecurity incidents so that decisions regarding public disclosure and other required reporting can be made by the appropriate personnel in a timely manner.'

name: Data Subject Rights Response Policy
description: Policy establishing procedures for receiving, validating, and responding to data subject access, deletion, correction, portability, and opt-out requests under GDPR, CCPA/CPRA, and other privacy laws. Rackspace Privacy Notice provides exercise mechanisms and designates privacy@rackspace.com. com/information/legal/privacystatement.

name: Quality Management Policy
description: Policy establishing quality management objectives, process standardization, and continuous improvement for UK enterprise and support functions. ISO 9001 certified. com/compliance/iso.

name: Cookie and Online Tracking Notice
description: Published notice governing use of cookies, web beacons, and tracking technologies on Rackspace Technology websites. Provides opt-out mechanism via cookie consent tool. Required by GDPR Art 7 consent requirements, ePrivacy Directive, and CCPA opt-out provisions. com/information/legal/privacystatement (cookie notice reference).

name: Incident Management Policy
description: ITIL-aligned policy governing detection, logging, categorization, prioritization, escalation, and resolution of service incidents. Defines severity levels (S1-S4), response/resolution SLA targets, major incident management procedures, and post-incident review requirements. Rackspace operates ITIL-based incident management via ServiceNow across 24x7x365 support model. Separate from security incident response (pol-012) — this covers service availability incidents. com/cloud/rackspace-managed-cloud (ITIL-based operations confirmed), ServiceNow implementation whitepaper, SDM job postings referencing ITIL incident process.

name: Problem Management Policy
description: ITIL-aligned policy governing identification, analysis, and resolution of root causes underlying recurring incidents. Covers reactive problem analysis, proactive trend analysis, known error database management, and permanent fix coordination. Confirmed via SDM job postings requiring ITIL Problem Management process ownership. com Rackspace SDM posting (ITIL Process Lead referencing Problem process), ITIL 4 Practice Guide.

name: Change Management Policy — ITSM
description: ITIL-aligned policy governing standard, normal, and emergency changes to customer-facing service infrastructure. Covers change advisory board (CAB) processes, risk assessment, scheduling, implementation, and post-implementation review. Distinct from security change management (pol-019) — this covers ITSM service changes. Confirmed via Rackspace Managed Cloud description: 'Change, knowledge and deployment management.' com/cloud/rackspace-managed-cloud.

name: Service Level Management Policy
description: Policy governing definition, negotiation, monitoring, and reporting of service level agreements (SLAs) with customers. Rackspace publishes product-specific SLAs for cloud, dedicated hosting, and managed services. SLA credit process documented. Covers SLA design, operational level agreements (OLAs), underpinning contracts, and service level reporting. com/information/legal/cloud/sla, docs.rackspace.com/docs/request-an-sla-credit.

name: Service Catalog Management Policy
description: Policy governing maintenance, publication, and lifecycle management of the Rackspace service catalog. Defines service descriptions, service levels, pricing, and ordering procedures for all customer-facing services. SDM job posting references 'Service Portfolio Management process.'

provenance.primary_data_source: SDM job posting, ITIL 4 Service Catalog Management

name: Knowledge Management Policy
description: Policy governing creation, capture, review, and distribution of organizational knowledge across support teams. Confirmed via Rackspace Managed Cloud: 'Change, knowledge and deployment management.' Covers knowledge article lifecycle, review cadence, knowledge base access controls, and knowledge-centered service (KCS) practices. com/cloud/rackspace-managed-cloud.

name: Release and Deployment Management Policy
description: Policy governing planning, scheduling, and controlling movement of releases to test and live environments. Confirmed via Rackspace Managed Cloud description: 'Change, knowledge and deployment management' and 'Service testing validation and configuration management.' com/cloud/rackspace-managed-cloud.

name: Event and Monitoring Management Policy
description: Policy governing monitoring strategy, event detection, filtering, correlation, and automated response for customer infrastructure. Rackspace Cloud Monitoring service, 24x7x365 SOC monitoring, and proactive detection confirmed. Confirmed via managed cloud: 'Incident, event and problem management.' com/cloud/rackspace-managed-cloud, rackspace.com/security.

name: Capacity and Performance Management Policy
description: Policy governing capacity planning, demand management, and performance optimization across customer and internal infrastructure. Rackspace offers capacity planning as part of intensive service level. com Intensive Service Level Data Sheet (capacity planning references), ITIL 4 Capacity and Performance Management.

name: Availability Management Policy
description: Policy governing design, implementation, and measurement of service availability to meet agreed SLA targets. Covers availability design, component failure impact analysis, single points of failure elimination, and high availability architecture standards. Required by SOC 2 Availability criteria (A1).

provenance.primary_data_source: AICPA SOC 2 Trust Services Criteria A1

name: Continual Service Improvement Policy
description: Policy establishing framework for ongoing improvement of IT service management processes, service quality, and operational efficiency. Aligns with ISO 27001 Clause 10 (Improvement), ITIL 4 continual improvement model, and ISO 9001 PDCA cycle.

name: Software Development Lifecycle Policy
description: Enterprise SDLC policy establishing phases, gates, deliverables, and quality standards for all software development including internal tools, customer-facing platforms, and Rackspace Fabric automation. Covers requirements, design, implementation, testing, deployment, and maintenance phases. Rackspace Fabric includes 'automation that ranges from service delivery to self-healing infrastructure' (10-K).

provenance.primary_data_source: 10-K FY2024 (Rackspace Fabric description), industry standard for technology companies

name: Code Review and Quality Assurance Policy
description: Policy establishing mandatory code review, static analysis, unit testing coverage requirements, and quality gates before production deployment. Required by ISO 27001 A.8.25 (Secure development lifecycle), PCI DSS Req 6.2.3 (code review). 8.25, PCI DSS v4.0 Req 6.

name: API Security and Management Policy
description: Policy governing API design standards, authentication/authorization (OAuth 2.0, API keys), rate limiting, versioning, deprecation, and security testing for all Rackspace APIs including Cloud Control Panel APIs and internal service APIs. Rackspace provides extensive APIs documented at docs.rackspace.com. rackspace.com API documentation, industry standard for cloud service providers.

name: Source Code Management and Intellectual Property Policy
description: Policy governing source code repository access controls, branching strategies, code ownership, licensing compliance, and IP protection. Required for SOX compliance (internal controls over financial reporting systems) and trade secret protection.

name: Data Governance Policy
description: Enterprise policy establishing data governance framework including data ownership, stewardship, quality standards, lineage tracking, and master data management. Covers data as a strategic asset across all business units. Rackspace data privacy page references 'data governance encompasses the policies and practices that serve as a foundation for data management.' com/blog/what-data-security.

name: Data Quality Policy
description: Policy establishing data quality dimensions (accuracy, completeness, consistency, timeliness, validity), measurement, monitoring, and remediation processes across enterprise data assets. Required for reliable SEC financial reporting and customer data integrity.

provenance.primary_data_source: Industry best practice, SOX financial data integrity requirements

name: Data Architecture and Modeling Standards Policy
description: Policy establishing enterprise data architecture standards, naming conventions, modeling methodologies, and metadata management requirements.

provenance.primary_data_source: Industry best practice for enterprise data management

name: Database Administration and Management Policy
description: Policy governing database provisioning, access controls, performance tuning, backup/recovery, and lifecycle management. Rackspace provides managed database services (ObjectRocket, managed MySQL, managed SQL Server).

name: Internal Controls Over Financial Reporting Policy
description: SOX Section 404-compliant policy establishing framework for designing, implementing, and evaluating internal controls over financial reporting. CEO/CFO certification requirements. Material weakness identification and remediation procedures.

name: Insider Trading and Securities Compliance Policy
description: Policy establishing blackout periods, pre-clearance requirements, and reporting obligations for directors, officers, and employees trading in Rackspace Technology securities. Required by Securities Exchange Act Section 16, SEC Rule 10b5-1.

name: Revenue Recognition Policy
description: Policy establishing revenue recognition principles in accordance with ASC 606 for Rackspace service contracts including recurring revenue, professional services, and multi-element arrangements.

name: Disclosure Committee Charter and Policy
description: Policy establishing disclosure committee responsibilities for reviewing material information, ensuring timely and accurate SEC filings (10-K, 10-Q, 8-K), and coordinating with legal, finance, and cybersecurity teams on materiality determinations.

name: Travel and Expense Policy
description: Enterprise policy governing employee business travel, expense reporting, reimbursement procedures, and corporate card usage. Required for SOX internal controls over financial reporting and prevention of fraudulent expense claims.

provenance.primary_data_source: SOX Section 404 internal controls, industry standard

name: Procurement and Purchasing Policy
description: Policy governing vendor selection, purchase authorization thresholds, purchase order management, and competitive bidding requirements. Required for SOX internal controls (segregation of duties, authorization controls).

name: Equal Employment Opportunity and Anti-Discrimination Policy
description: Policy establishing commitment to equal employment opportunity and prohibition of discrimination based on protected characteristics. Rackspace scored 100% on Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and is named Best Place to Work for LGBTQ+ Equality.

provenance.primary_data_source: 2021 ESG Report, HRC Corporate Equality Index

name: Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging Policy
description: Policy establishing DIB objectives, Racker Resource Groups (Together with Pride, POWER, RISE, and six others), recruitment diversity targets, and inclusive workplace practices. Rackspace ESG Report highlights DIB as 'critically important to our culture.' com/about/responsibility.

name: Anti-Harassment and Workplace Conduct Policy
description: Policy prohibiting harassment, bullying, and hostile work environment. Establishes reporting mechanisms, investigation procedures, and disciplinary actions.

provenance.primary_data_source: Title VII, state employment laws, industry standard for 9,000+ employee enterprise

name: Remote Work and Flexible Working Policy
description: Policy governing remote/hybrid work arrangements, home office security requirements, VPN usage, and equipment provisioning. Rackspace operates with distributed workforce model and has been recognized as Best Place to Work for Parents Working Remotely.

name: Employee Onboarding and Offboarding Policy
description: Policy establishing standardized procedures for new hire onboarding (access provisioning, security training, equipment) and employee departure (access revocation, asset return, knowledge transfer, exit interview). Required by ISO 27001 A.6.1-A.6.5 (People controls). 6.

name: Anti-Bribery and Anti-Corruption Policy
description: Policy establishing zero tolerance for bribery and corruption in compliance with US Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA) and UK Bribery Act 2010. Covers gifts, entertainment, facilitation payments, third-party due diligence, and government official interactions. Required for a NASDAQ-listed company with global operations in 40+ countries.

provenance.primary_data_source: FCPA, UK Bribery Act 2010, Code of Conduct

name: Compensation and Benefits Policy
description: Policy governing employee compensation structures, bonus programs, equity incentive plans, and benefits administration. 10-K discloses equity compensation plans. Required for SEC proxy statement disclosures and SOX compensation committee oversight.

name: Workplace Health and Safety Policy
description: Policy establishing workplace safety standards, hazard identification, emergency procedures, and occupational health programs across all Rackspace offices and data center facilities. ISO 45001 cert OHS 587454 for UK operations. com/compliance/iso (ISO 45001), OSHA requirements.

name: Website Terms of Use
description: Legal terms governing use of rackspace.com and associated digital properties. Covers intellectual property, user conduct, disclaimer of warranties, limitation of liability, and governing law. com/information/legal.

name: Cookie Policy
description: Published policy governing use of first-party and third-party cookies, web beacons, and tracking pixels on Rackspace Technology websites. Provides granular opt-in/opt-out via cookie consent management platform. Required by GDPR Art 7, ePrivacy Directive 2002/58/EC, CCPA opt-out. Rackspace Privacy Notice references Cookie Notice with consent tool. Supersedes pol-055 Cookie Notice as a standalone policy. com/information/legal/privacystatement (cookie notice reference), GDPR Art 7.

name: Digital Marketing and Communications Policy
description: Policy governing email marketing, advertising campaigns, lead generation, CAN-SPAM/CASL/PECR compliance, opt-in/opt-out management, and brand usage in marketing materials. AUP references spam prohibitions and email consent requirements. com/en-nl/information/legal/global/aup (email marketing provisions), CAN-SPAM Act.

name: Social Media Policy
description: Policy governing official and employee use of social media platforms, brand representation, disclosure requirements, and crisis communication protocols.

provenance.primary_data_source: Industry standard for NASDAQ-listed company, SEC Regulation FD considerations

name: Trademark, Copyright, and Intellectual Property Policy
description: Policy governing protection and authorized use of Rackspace Technology trademarks (Rackspace®, Fanatical Experience®, Racker), copyrights, and service marks. Published at rackspace.com/information/legal. com/information/legal (Copyright and Trademarks page).

name: Brand Guidelines and Usage Policy
description: Policy establishing visual identity standards, logo usage, typography, color palette, and co-branding requirements for Rackspace Technology brand across all channels.

provenance.primary_data_source: Industry standard for global enterprise brand management

name: Accessibility Policy
description: Policy establishing web accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1 AA) for rackspace.com and customer portal interfaces. Required for ADA Title III compliance (digital accessibility) and Section 508 for government customers. 1.

name: Master Services Agreement Policy
description: Policy governing the structure, terms, and management of Rackspace Master Services Agreement (MSA) — the foundational legal agreement between Rackspace and customers. Three-document framework: Service Order + MSA + Product Terms. Published at rackspace.com/information/legal/GSA. com/en-gb/information/legal/contract-structure.

name: Service Level Agreement Management Policy
description: Policy governing design, approval, publication, and enforcement of product-specific SLAs including uptime guarantees, credit calculation methodology, and credit request processing. Published SLAs at rackspace.com/information/legal/cloud/sla. 30-day credit request window. com/information/legal/cloud/sla, docs.rackspace.com/docs/request-an-sla-credit.

name: Contract Lifecycle Management Policy
description: Policy governing contract creation, review, approval workflow, execution, storage, and renewal/termination management across all Rackspace commercial agreements.

provenance.primary_data_source: Industry standard for enterprise legal operations

name: Conflict Minerals Policy
description: Policy establishing due diligence procedures for supply chain conflict minerals compliance under Dodd-Frank Section 1502. Rackspace ESG report references supplier engagement on conflict minerals standards. com/about/responsibility, Dodd-Frank Act Section 1502.

name: Supplier Code of Conduct
description: Policy establishing ethical, labor, environmental, and security standards for Rackspace suppliers and partners. ESG report references: 'We strive to engage with suppliers who adhere to stringent standards' and 'full lifecycle sustainability in their products and services.' com/about/responsibility.

name: Environmental Sustainability Policy
description: Published environmental policy establishing commitments to carbon reduction, renewable energy adoption, smart building automation, and net zero emissions by 2045. Covers GHG emissions measurement (Scope 1/2/3), CDP Climate Change reporting, and UK Climate Change Agreement participation. Downloadable from rackspace.com/about/responsibility. com/about/responsibility, 2023 ESG Report, UK Carbon Reduction Plan.

name: Community Engagement and Corporate Philanthropy Policy
description: Policy governing Rackspace Foundation activities, employee volunteer programs, charitable giving, and community partnerships. Rackspace Foundation active since 2008. com/about/responsibility.

name: Responsible AI Policy
description: Policy establishing principles for responsible AI development and deployment including fairness, transparency, accountability, and human oversight. ESG report references 'responsible AI principles.' Separate from AI Governance Policy (pol-047) which covers regulatory compliance — this covers ethical AI principles. com/blog/it-sustainability (responsible AI references).

name: Document Retention and Destruction Schedule
description: Operational schedule defining retention periods for all corporate document categories including financial records (7 years SOX), contracts, employee records, tax records, and corporate communications. Supports Records Management Policy (pol-051).

provenance.primary_data_source: SOX Section 802, IRS document retention requirements

name: Crisis Management and Business Communication Policy
description: Policy establishing crisis management team, communication protocols, spokesperson designation, media relations, and stakeholder notification procedures for enterprise-level crises. Rackspace 2022 ransomware incident demonstrated need for crisis communication infrastructure.

name: Anti-Money Laundering and Sanctions Screening Policy
description: Policy establishing customer due diligence, sanctions screening (OFAC SDN, EU/UK sanctions lists), and suspicious activity reporting procedures. AUP prohibits services for entities involved in terrorism, narcotics trafficking, or arms trafficking. com/en-nl/information/legal/global/aup (Section 7 sanctions provisions), Bank Secrecy Act.

name: Delegation of Authority Policy
description: Policy establishing financial approval thresholds, signing authorities, and authorization matrices for contracts, expenditures, and corporate commitments across management levels. Required for SOX segregation of duties and internal controls.

name: Related Party Transaction Policy
description: Policy governing identification, review, and approval of transactions between Rackspace and related parties (directors, officers, significant shareholders). Required by SEC regulations and SOX.

name: Customer Onboarding and Migration Policy
description: Policy establishing standardized procedures for new customer onboarding, cloud migration planning, implementation coordination, and service activation. Rackspace offers dedicated Implementation Specialist/Coordinator. com Service Level Data Sheets, customer onboarding documentation.

name: Customer Data Security and Privacy Shared Responsibility Policy
description: Policy defining the shared responsibility model between Rackspace and customers for security and privacy across infrastructure, platform, and application layers. Published at rackspace.com. Rackspace GDPR page references 'shared responsibility which is why we generally require our customers to secure and encrypt.' com/gdpr, rackspace.com/information/legal/privacycenter.

name: End-of-Life and Service Deprecation Policy
description: Policy governing lifecycle management, end-of-support (EOS), end-of-life (EOL) timelines, and customer notification procedures for deprecated services and platforms. Extended Lifecycle Support page referenced on docs.rackspace.com. rackspace.com (Extended Lifecycle Support references).

name: Customer Escalation and Complaint Management Policy
description: Policy establishing tiered escalation paths, executive escalation procedures, and customer complaint resolution timelines. Rackspace 'Fanatical Experience' brand built on support escalation excellence.

provenance.primary_data_source: Rackspace Fanatical Experience brand, service delivery model

name: Data Center Operations Policy
description: Policy governing data center operational standards including power management (N+1 redundancy), cooling, environmental monitoring, fire suppression, cable management, and capacity planning across 27 data center facilities.

provenance.primary_data_source: 10-K FY2024 (data center operations), industry standard for colocation/hosting provider

name: Visitor Access and Escort Policy
description: Policy governing visitor registration, identification verification, escort requirements, and access logging for all Rackspace facilities including data centers, offices, and delivery centers. Required by ISO 27001 A.7.2, PCI DSS Req 9.4. 7.2, PCI DSS v4.0 Req 9.
